result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephen S. VICE Sr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Use only one doctor and only one pharmacy unless agent approves otherwise.

At 9:05 a.m., search warrant for 2335 Roosevelt Avenue, Two Rivers, WI with return of officer thereon.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 3 counts deliver heroin as repeater and 3 counts keeper of drug house.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 10-05-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $3,000.00 cash with the conditions that he report to the Two Rivers City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release and he maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.   Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody. Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued. Copy filed.
